lead_paragraph: Picture a tiny hole in the hull of a ship on a long ocean voyage. It is slowly letting in water. If the hole isn't plugged, the leak will eventually slow the vessel drastically - maybe even sink it, Jeff Sommer writes in The New York Times.
snippet: It's worth paying attention to the niggling details of mutual fund fees -- and to the Securities and Exchange Commission's July 21 proposal to alter the rules that control them.

headline.main: Small Step on Small Fees, but Big Charges Remain

abstract: It's worth paying attention to the niggling details of mutual fund fees -- and to the Securities and Exchange Commission's July 21 proposal to alter the rules that control them.
